page.title: 08Staxigoe Harbour
page.content: Staxigoe was famous for Herring fishing and was the main port of Caithness at one time. It now has about eight small boats which are kept there when they are not in use. They fish for crabs, lobsters, herring and mackerel around the coastline of Staxigoe. During stormy weather the boats are taken out of the harbour by their owners so that they don't get damaged. Builders have started to improve the harbour by making a new road leading down to it, a new slipway and a picnic area. In the summer Staxigoe harbour is a very popular place for swimming in. Many tourists come to see and take photos of the Stack-rock which is beside the harbour and gave the village its name.
